intro: Jacksonia mollissima, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the daisy family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its attractive appearance. It prefers well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for temperate climates. Jacksonia mollissima is also valued for its traditional uses by Māori people, including the use of its fibers for weaving.
